definition: to pay back a score/to get revenge/to requite/(old) variant of 抱怨[bao4 yuan4]
to return good for evil (idiom)/to requite evil with good
to repay kindness with kindness, and repay enmity with justice (idiom, from Analects)
pinyin: yi3 zhi2 bao4 yuan4 , yi3 de2 bao4 de2

sentences.english: Bible says to requite evil with good.
How call you have the gall to complain about other people's being lazy?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么能厚着脸皮报怨说别人不勤快？

sentences.english: He had to render an apology for his rudeness.
sentences.chinese: 他一直是个以德报怨的人。

sentences.english: Returned home to mother complained, zhang zhang mother called Yang ink green the black sheep of his family.
sentences.chinese: 回到家向张母报怨，张母大骂杨墨青败家子。

sentences.english: He is the man who always renders good for evil.
sentences.chinese: 他一向是个以德报怨的人。

sentences.english: Forill do well, then fear not hell.
Good for good eery man can do, good for bad only a noble man can do.
sentences.chinese: 以德报怨只有高尚的人才能办到。

sentences.english: He those rechangings good for evil obtains the victory.
sentences.chinese: 以德报怨的人得到胜利。

sentences.english: That daughter of your cousin’s is constantly complaining.
sentences.chinese: 你表哥的那个女儿老是在报怨。

sentences.english: My father taught me to render good for evil.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲教导我要以德报怨。

sentences.english: The sages of ancient times taught us to render good for evil.
sentences.chinese: 古代圣贤教导我们要以德报怨。

sentences.english: The bible says to requite evil with good.
He refuses to return incivility from incivility, because then he would no longer be in command of his own conduct.
sentences.chinese: 他不以怨报怨，那样，他将不再是自己行为的主宰。

definition: to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
to return good for evil (idiom)/to requite evil with good
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
lit. belly full of complaints (idiom)/discontent/always moaning and complaining
to vent one's anger on an innocent party (idiom)
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
